lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Awn ibrK sPl hoq smY pwie sRbdw PlMqy sdw Pl su sÍwid hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Aan Birakh Sadhal Hot Samai Paai , Srabadaa Dhalantay Sadaa Dhal Su Svaadi Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tree bears fruit at a certain time of the year, but there are some trees which bear fruit all the time (like Kalap Variksh) and their fruit is very tasty too.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kUp jl inksq hY jqn kIey gMgw jl mukiq pÍwh pRswid hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Koop Jal Nikasat Hai Jatan Keeay , Gangaa Jal Moukati Pravaah Prasaadi Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as drawing water from the well demands some effort, but the flow of water in river Ganges is continuous and in plenty.

lines.gurmukhi: miRqkw Agin qUl qyl myl dIp idpY jgmg joiq ssIAr ibsmwd hY
lines.transliteration_english: Mritakaa Agani Tool Tayl Mayl Deep Dipai , Jagamag Joti Saseear Bisamaad Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the combination of an earthen lamp, oil, cotton and fire results in a light-giving lamp that spreads its radiance in a limited place, but the radiance of the moon shines in the whole world and spreads strange happiness all around.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy Awn dyv syv kIey Plu dyq jyq siqgur drs n swsn jmwd hY ]456]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Aan Dayv Sayv Keeay Dhalu Dayt Jayta , Satigur Daras N Saasan Jamaad Hai ?456?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, whatever quantum of devoted service one performs for a god, one receives reward accordingly. But a vision of the True teacher dispels the fear of angels of death beside blessing I one with many other goods. (All gods grant goods to their follow
